goal.ch: This course introduces various basic mathematical techniques to first-year undergraduate students.  These techniques are commonly used in sciences and engineering.
goal.en: This course introduces various basic mathematical techniques to first-year undergraduate students.  These techniques are commonly used in sciences and engineering.

outline.ch:
1. A brief introduction to scalar and vector single-variable functions, differentiation and integration, fundamental theorem of calculus.
Applications: displacement, velocity, and acceleration in 1d and 3d, work in 1d and 3d.
2. A brief introduction to multivariable scalar and vector functions (fields), differentiation (i.e., partial derivative) and integration of them.
Applications: work and conservative forces, potential energy
3. Functions, limits, and continuity.
4. Derivatives: differentiation rules, chain rule, implicit differentiation, etc.
5. Applications of differentiation: trigonometric functions, exponential functions, natural logarithms, hyperbolic functions, inverse of these functions, complex numbers
6. More applications of differentiation: extreme values, mean-value theorem, monotonic functions, concavity, optimization problems, Newton method, antiderivatives, etc.
7. Integrals: definite integral, indefinite integrals, substitution rule, etc.
8. Applications of Integration: areas, volumes, arc length, area of a surface of revolution, work, etc.
9. Techniques of Integration: integration by parts, partial fractions, trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitutions, improper integrals, etc.
10. Sequences and Series
11. Applications: oscillations, waves
outline.en:
1. A brief introduction to scalar and vector single-variable functions, differentiation and integration, fundamental theorem of calculus.
Applications: displacement, velocity, and acceleration in 1d and 3d, work in 1d and 3d.
2. A brief introduction to multivariable scalar and vector functions (fields), differentiation (i.e., partial derivative) and integration of them.
Applications: work and conservative forces, potential energy
3. Functions, limits, and continuity.
4. Derivatives: differentiation rules, chain rule, implicit differentiation, etc.
5. Applications of differentiation: trigonometric functions, exponential functions, natural logarithms, hyperbolic functions, inverse of these functions, complex numbers
6. More applications of differentiation: extreme values, mean-value theorem, monotonic functions, concavity, optimization problems, Newton method, antiderivatives, etc.
7. Integrals: definite integral, indefinite integrals, substitution rule, etc.
8. Applications of Integration: areas, volumes, arc length, area of a surface of revolution, work, etc.
9. Techniques of Integration: integration by parts, partial fractions, trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitutions, improper integrals, etc.
10. Sequences and Series
11. Applications: oscillations, waves

textbook.ch: Thomas‘ Calculus, 14th Edition (in SI units), Pearson Education Inc 2020, or any other book you choose.
textbook.en: Thomas‘ Calculus, 14th Edition (in SI units), Pearson Education Inc 2020, or any other book you choose.
